thread.title: Adi scores on penalty kick; Timbers beat 10-man Real Salt Lake 1-0 to move into 5th-place tie
thread.title_full: Adi scores on penalty kick; Timbers beat 10-man Real Salt Lake 1-0 to move into 5th-place tie

title: Adi scores on penalty kick; Timbers beat 10-man Real Salt Lake 1-0 to move into 5th-place tie
text:
Adi scores on penalty kick; Timbers beat 10-man Real Salt Lake 1-0 to move into 5th-place tie THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   14, 2015 - 11:56 pmLast Updated: October 14, 2015 - 11:56 pm   
People: 
Men's sports (2326) 
SANDY, Utah â€” Fanendo Adi scored on a penalty kick in the 54th minute, and the Portland Timbers beat 10-man Real Salt Lake 1-0 on Wednesday night for their third straight road win in the series. 
Portland (13-11-8) moved into a tie with Seattle for fifth in the Western Conference. Real Salt Lake (11-13-8) is tied for eighth, six points back of the Timbers. 
Jamison Olave was given a straight red card in the 52nd minute for taking down Lucas Melano in a goal-scoring position. Nick Rimando picked the wrong direction on Adi's penalty kick. 
Adi had a close-range shot saved in the 21st, and Rimando came out of his box to block Adi's fast-break attempt in the 44th. 
Adam Kwarasey preserved his MLS-leading 13th shutout with a reaction save of Javier Morales deflected shot in the 91st.
